# Creating a package

Packages can be very useful when working in R. Here, I demonstrate how I've created the package called ...

```{r setting up, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
```


```{r, eval=FALSE}
df_summary <- df %>% summarise(mean = mean(x), sd = sd(x))
df %>% filter() %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = x, y = y, colour = z))+
  geom_point()+
  theme_classic()+
  labs(title = "",
       x = "",
       y = "")
```


```{r, eval=FALSE}
hematocrit_paired <-read_csv2(here("lesson4/hematocrit_paired"))
hematocrit_tidy <-  pivot_longer(data = hematocrit_paired, cols = c(voor, na),  
                                 names_to = "condition",  values_to = "hematocrit")

hematocrit_tidy_summary <- hematocrit_tidy %>% group_by(condition) %>%
  summarize(mean = mean(hematocrit), stdev = sd(hematocrit))
hematocrit_tidy_summary %>% ggplot(aes(x = condition, y = mean))+
  geom_bar(stat = "identity")+
  geom_errorbar(aes(ymin = mean - stdev, ymax = mean + stdev), width = 0.2)+
  theme_minimal()+
  labs(title = "Hematocrit values before and after an altitude workout",
       subtitle = "errorbars depict 1 standard devation",
       x = "Condition",
       y = "Hematocrit (%)")+
  theme(legend.position = "none", text = element_text(size=14))
```
